website_summaries.verdict: It's great that Tivoli added Bluetooth streaming to its great little PAL radio, but its $300 price tag is excessive.
pros: The Tivoli PAL BT retains the wonderful retro design, compact form factor, strong battery life, and excellent AM/FM radio of its predecessors, while adding Bluetooth compatibility
It offers surprisingly big sound for its size
cons: The Bluetooth performance (and overall sound quality) is decent but not good enough for a $300 speaker -- yes, it's overpriced

customer_reviews.title: No longer works when plugged into the wall!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Pal Radios for years, the new version requires a 9 volt charger rather than a 12 volt charger. Buyer beware this newer 9 volt version will not play while charging. According to Tivoli this change was made to extend the battery life. Brilliant! So in the middle of listening to the radio when the battery dies you have to wait until the battery has recharged before you resume listening. The portability and the ability to listen while charging and on the battery was the major reason I continued to purchase PAL radio instead of going to the Sonos system, not any more.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: The white ones are nice as they stay clean
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have bought 3 over the years. They are expensive, but you get what you pay for. The white ones are nice as they stay clean. Bluetooth works. My wife bangs the headphone jack when the radio falls over, and the socket comes loose, so we need to get another; not the fault of Tivoli, just a heads up. Love the radio, sound is balanced and awesome. Looks cool in my office. Works best with the antenna down and the charging cord unplugged; we are also on a boat with very bad reception, but this picks up when others will not. I would buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Lee R.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design, good sound for streaming.
customer_reviews.text: Love the look and the ease of set-up/pairing to my devices. Great physical design. Sound is great when streaming music, but the radio quality Is very staticky unless antenna is in the exact correct position, , and even then there’s an on and off static sound. I got this strictly to listen to NPR in the morning while getting ready for my day, but gave up on that and now just stream NPR. However, I also love sports and political talk radio and since they’re all AM stations (except NPR) the sound is poor.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Might send back.
customer_reviews.text: Since this wasn’t a real cheap product, I had high hopes for it. However, I think I may have to send it back. I cannot get a.m. stations without so much static I can’t listen to it. I’ve tried it in every room, plugged in and not plugged in, and even turned my WiFi router off in case that was interfering. I took it outside and found a few spots about 25 feet away from the house where I could get clear a.m. if I held it in certain directions.
customer_reviews.author: M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Tivoli Audio Bluetooth and iPhone will not pair
customer_reviews.text: I can't recommend it for bluetooth connection if you too have an Apple product like an iPhone or MacBook. Works fine as a radio and rather stylish. I have scoured the internet seeking ideas to try and pair with bluetooth setting but other posters say the same thing. Tivoli Audio says it is Apples fault that they won't work with third-party vendors but I have a Ecoxgear speaker that pairs perfectly. I have given up trying but if any readers have a work around please post.
customer_reviews.author: webbizy

customer_reviews.title: PAL unique styling but no better than portable radio
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking at the PAL from Tivoli for years, finally decided to buy one. I have plenty of portable Bluetooth speaker devices. What I really wanted was the added tuner feature. Overall, it functions as intended. The shape is convenient for placing anywhere. The single speaker sounds ok, but there are many better sounding options available. The battery power is respectable, lasting about 8-10 hours on a charge. The tuner is somewhat disappointing. I expected it to lock on to a station much better. All things considered, its nothing more than a portable radio. To earn more stars, the tuner and speaker need to be improved.

I bought it primarily because its one of the few speakers I could find that had FM and AM radio plus blue tooth. One other big plus... the battery lasts a long time. You could have this out in the garden all day without running out of juice.

All of them experienced jitter and lag, if not outright loss of signal, at distance or close. If you want a great radio or Aux hardwired speaker - great product, if you need it for Bluetooth....it's a no go.

The PAL's portability, range, and BT are excellent, and it looks pretty cool, too! One of the best purchases we've made.

product_meta.title: Tivoli Audio PAL BT - Bluetooth Portable AM/FM Radio in High Gloss Red/White
product_meta.description: Color:RedThe PAL BT is Tivoli Audio’s simple take on audio, quality and style, in a portable package. The weather-resistant cabinet and long-lasting battery mean the PAL BT can bring hours of enjoyment wherever life takes you. Vintage inspired with vivid pop colors and 3 simple functional knobs, the PAL BT embodies a simpler time when audio quality and reception were most important, but its looks can be deceiving. With multiple source options, including AM/FM radio, Bluetooth streaming and an AUX-in, you can enjoy music from any source through the PAL BT’s finely tuned speaker.
feature_bullets: Perfectly proportioned, the PAL BT’s three knobs are laid out for functionality and balanced visual appeal.
With built-in Bluetooth stream high quality audio from your favorite source
With 16 hours of battery playback, the PAL BT will play all your favorite music and radio stations wherever and whenever you need
Uses Bluetooth wireless technology's advanced A2DP profile for high-quality audio
Frequency Hopping Spread Spectrum (FHSS) results in low-to-no noise interference with other wireless devices
The weather-resistant housing was designed to keep the elements out while providing the perfect acoustic chamber.
